means: 讨好，谄媚( ingratiate的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: His fellow students had found him too ingratiating.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的同学们发现他太爱奉承了。

sentence.Network_en: He said this with an ingratiating smile.
sentence.Network_cn: 他面带奉承地笑着说了这番话。

sentence.Network_en: Polchenko is civil , almost ingratiating , as he argues with the leader.
sentence.Network_cn: 波尔钦科 和这个头头辩论时也彬彬有礼, 甚至有点迎合奉承.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 词根辅助记忆GRE单词 - 豆丁网 ... gratuitous a. 无缘无故的，免费的 ingratiating a. 逢迎的，迷人的 ingrate n. 忘恩负义之人.
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... ingratiate v 迎合，讨好 ingratiating a 讨好的，诌媚的 gratify v 使满足；喜悦.
GRE逆序_馆档网 ... excruciating 极痛苦的 ingratiating 讨好的，谄媚的 scintillating 才气横溢的.

list.abs: ingratiation 奉承ingratiation tactics 讨好策略ingratitude 忘恩负义
He contrived an eager , ingratiating smile , which he bestowed on Mr. Squires ., 他装出一副殷勤 , 讨好的笑脸 , 并把它投向史奎尔斯先生.
someone with an assured and ingratiating manner ., 有确实的和迷人的举止的人.
an Lushan , an enormously fat man , was adept at playing buffoon in order to ingratiate himself .安禄山是一个非常肥胖的男人，擅长表演小丑来取悦自己。

entry.tran: 讨人喜欢的;迎合的;奉承的
entry.def: If you describe someone or their behaviour as ingratiating, you mean that they try to make people like them.

example.ex: He said this with an ingratiating smile...
example.tran: 他面带奉承地笑着说了这番话。

example.ex: His fellow students had found him too ingratiating.
example.tran: 他的同学们发现他太爱奉承了。

sentences.sentence: "with open arms and an ingratiating smile"

means.word_mean: 2. calculated to please or gain favor;

auth_sentence.content: He was certainly at his most ingratiating.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was certainly at his most ingratiating.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was certainly at his most ingratiating.

auth_sentence.content: Ingratiating oneself to such group moors seems a dubious way to gain status.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ingratiating oneself to such group moors seems a dubious way to gain status.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ingratiating oneself to such group moors seems a dubious way to gain status.

auth_sentence.content: It is utterly patronising, pathetically ingratiating and intellectually lame, but, he adds: It works.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is utterly patronising, pathetically ingratiating and intellectually lame, but, he adds: It works.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is utterly patronising, pathetically ingratiating and intellectually lame, but, he adds: It works.

stems_affixes.word_buile: grate=grat感激,高兴+ful充满……的→adj.[to,for]感激的;感谢的
gratuity[[n.赏钱,小费]]涔吹腫给小费可多可少]→所以"无缘无故"的
ingratiate[v.逢迎,讨好]+ing……的→adj.讨好的,谄媚的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 优美,文雅;恩惠,恩泽;宽限,缓刑;感恩祷告
stems_affixes.word_buile: grace=grat感激,高兴→感激别人态度一定好,所以grace有了"文雅"的意义
grat感激,高兴+itude状态→n.感激,感谢
grat感激,高兴+uity=ity表名词→因感激而给小钱,小费
in不+grat感激,高兴+e→不感谢→忘恩负义

stems_affixes.value_cn: 祝贺, 庆贺, 恭喜
stems_affixes.word_buile: con共同+gratulate[v.欢迎, 祝]→v.祝贺, 庆贺, 恭喜
grat感激,高兴+ify使……→使[人]满足,高兴
grat感激,高兴+ulate→让[别人]高兴→祝贺
in使……+grat感激,高兴+iate表动词→使别人高兴→讨好

sentences.cn: 虚情假意的，逢迎的方式
